title: Before he became president, did Donald Trump say that closing the government shows that the president is weak?
text: President Donald Trump said he'd have a government closure if he didn't get the money he wanted for a border wall. Now, there is a widely shared social media tour site that presents a picture of Trump with the following quote, attributed to 2013: "The closure is based on the President's lack of leadership. He can't even control his party and bring people together in a room. "Closing means the president is weak." Did Trump really say that? The article was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) This was supposed to be said during the 2013 government closure during the Obama administration. We were not able to find this exact quote from Trump, in tweet or otherwise, but we followed several comments made at the time of the Government ' s closure in 2013, which supported the idea of blaming the President. The first time this alleged quote came to light earlier this year, when the government closed from January 20 to January 22, 2018. This closure was due to disagreement over the deferred programme of work for the arrival of children, known as the Development Assistance Committee (DAC). President Barack Obama was criticized by Trump during the 17-day closure of October 2013. This occurred after the budget for the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, known as "Obamakari," was challenged. But what did Trump actually say in 2013? We could not find a match with the quote attributed to Trump, but we identified similar comments. In an interview with Fox and Friends in September 2013, Trump blew up Obama for failing to "get everyone into a room."
